common_issues.title: Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Slow Performance
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance and high CPU usage, particularly with Long Term Memory (LTM) enabled. This affects Windows and potentially macOS, impacting apps like Slack, Discord, and Visual Studio. Proposed solutions include updating Pieces OS and related components, disabling/re-enabling LTM, and moving Pieces data to a different drive. However, a permanent fix is pending.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub conversation on high CPU usage in PiecesOS:

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage in PiecesOS, particularly with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature enabled.
* This affects both macOS and Windows users.
* The issue seems to be related to WebView2 and Edge browser usage.

**Problems identified:**

* High CPU utilization makes PiecesOS sluggish and unusable for some tasks.
* Discord and Microsoft Edge are particularly affected.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Patch releases for PiecesOS 11.2.2.
* Update Microsoft Edge and Microsoft Edge WebView2 Runtime.
* Disable and re-enable LTM to temporarily alleviate high CPU usage.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue persists for some users, with high CPU spikes even after updates and workarounds.
* Further investigation and fixes are expected in the following week.
* Moving folders com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd to a different drive and creating Symbolic Links might improve performance.
* Restarting LTM can temporarily reduce CPU usage for some users.

**Overall, the high CPU usage issue in PiecesOS is ongoing, with no permanent fix available yet.**

Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User bpluly experienced multiple issues with the Pieces application, including slowdowns and boot-up problems.
* User bpluly uninstalled the application due to frustration.

**Problems Identified:**

* Long Term Memory (LTM) slowdown.
* PiecesOS launch failure.
* Slow boot-up time.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces support bot offered troubleshooting suggestions and related issues.
* Mark from Pieces reached out to offer support and debugging assistance.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User uninstalled the application.
* Mark offered a call to discuss the user's experience and troubleshoot the issues.
* User's response to the call offer is unknown.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place in March 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Copilot Performance Issues

**Key Points:**

* Users reported drastic performance degradation for Copilot after updating to Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* Issues included slow response times, high CPU usage, and blocked responses.
* The problem persisted after hard-resetting the active runtime.

**Problems Identified:**

* Bug in the copilot experience related to clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime".
* A value was not being reset properly, causing the websocket to not reinitialize correctly.
* This resulted in Copilot hanging on the "..." loading indicator.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Released a patch in Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2 to fix the bug.
* Recommended users to update the apps and contact support if issues persisted.
* Released version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app with additional performance improvements.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved for some users after updating to the latest versions.
* Other users still experiencing lag, especially after the release of Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop version 3.0.2.
* Support team collecting details from affected users to investigate further.

common_issues.title: Copilot Performance Issues and Unexpected Responses

related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points:**

* User `seantiz` reported a bug where the copilot was not loading files into the context after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses.
* They were unable to reproduce the bug on their end.
* Pieces support suggested switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash to resolve the issue.
* User confirmed the bug was not present with the Flash LLM.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot not loading files into the context after a certain number of requests.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Switching the LLM to Gemini 2.0 Flash.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is believed to be fixed with the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* The ticket will be closed and the user will be notified if the issue persists in the next update of 11.2.3.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation mentions a related issue about a Secret Message example not working properly.
* The user was provided with resources such as existing issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Users reported encountering the error "Basic mode due to device constraints" on their M3 Macs.
* This error prevented them from accessing the "Workstream Activity" and seeing updates from the LTM.
* Users were confused about the meaning of "Basic mode" and why they were encountering the error.

**Problems identified:**

* Issue was caused by a bug in PiecesOS that mistakenly triggered the "Basic mode" on certain devices.
* Existing Workstream Activity view was not accessible in the smaller window size.
* An "unknown origin" element was showing in the telemetry browser, causing confusion.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces promised to fix the "Basic mode" bug in the next PiecesOS version.
* A solution for accessing the Workstream Activity in smaller window sizes was discussed, possibly by adding a hook to the home icon.
* Mack-at-pieces requested additional information regarding the "unknown origin" element.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The "Basic mode" bug is expected to be fixed in the next PiecesOS version.
* The issue with accessing the Workstream Activity on smaller window sizes has been acknowledged.
* The "unknown origin" element is being investigated.

**Additional notes:**

* Issue was discussed over several days, with multiple users and Pieces team members involved.
* Communication was clear and helpful, with Mark-at-pieces and Mack-at-pieces providing updates and potential solutions.

## Conclusion

The issue with the "Basic mode" error on M3 Macs has been identified and addressed. Additionally, the accessibility of the Workstream Activity on smaller window sizes and the "unknown origin" element are being investigated. The Pieces team is actively working to resolve these issues and improve the overall user experience.

common_issues.title: Ollama and LLM Download and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues downloading, installing, and canceling LLM downloads, particularly with Ollama and Mistral models. This is often due to dependency conflicts, snap confinement restrictions, or caching problems. Proposed solutions include modifying snap dependencies, clearing cache folders, and reinstalling Pieces OS. The development team is actively working on resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* User is unable to use Ollama LLM model due to "curl" command not being available in the snap environment.
* User downloaded and installed Ollama manually, but this did not resolve the issue.
* This issue prevents both downloading and using local LLM models.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces-os snap confinement restricts access to certain commands, including "curl".
* Ollama installation requires "curl" to download the model files.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Add "curl" to the list of dependencies in the snap definition file.
* Allow Ollama to be used from within the sandbox environment.
* Fix is in progress and expected to be released soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix is not yet available, but is expected to be released soon.
* Users are currently unable to use local LLM models.

**Additional Notes:**

* Other users are experiencing the same issue and are waiting for a resolution.
* Some users are concerned about the potential security risks of using cloud-based LLM models.
* The issue has been acknowledged by the developers and is being actively worked on.

related_issues.title: Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
related_issues.text:
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e730898-a168-4571-ab0d-6331c4d389a4)

i want stop but its not working 

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users reported an issue where they were unable to stop the Mistral 8 7b model download or delete it once stuck.
* This issue was experienced on both Windows and macOS.
* The issue appears to be related to cached data and/or library folders.

**Problems Identified:**

* The stop download button was unresponsive.
* Clicking the stop download button repeatedly caused the model to get stuck in the "Initialization" state.
* Other models displayed a "Please wait" message instead of the stuck initialization state.
* Deleting the model through the UI was not possible.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* AkhilTrivediX proposed a temporary fix involving deleting all files from the `C:/Users/[YOUR-USERNAME]/Documents/com.pieces.os/` folder and then doing a fresh install of both Pieces OS and the desktop app.
* jaybuidl suggested deleting all cache and library folders before reinstalling.
* mark-at-pieces mentioned that the Local Large Language Model stack was undergoing a complete replacement and would be in production within 2-3 weeks (as of November 18, 2024).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear whether the issue was fully resolved. 
* The proposed solutions may work for some users, but further investigation is needed to confirm.
* The issue may be mitigated by the upcoming replacement of the Local Large Language Model stack.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Users reported encountering the error "Basic mode due to device constraints" on their M3 Macs.
* This error prevented them from accessing the "Workstream Activity" and seeing updates from the LTM.
* Users were confused about the meaning of "Basic mode" and why they were encountering the error.

**Problems identified:**

* Issue was caused by a bug in PiecesOS that mistakenly triggered the "Basic mode" on certain devices.
* Existing Workstream Activity view was not accessible in the smaller window size.
* An "unknown origin" element was showing in the telemetry browser, causing confusion.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces promised to fix the "Basic mode" bug in the next PiecesOS version.
* A solution for accessing the Workstream Activity in smaller window sizes was discussed, possibly by adding a hook to the home icon.
* Mack-at-pieces requested additional information regarding the "unknown origin" element.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The "Basic mode" bug is expected to be fixed in the next PiecesOS version.
* The issue with accessing the Workstream Activity on smaller window sizes has been acknowledged.
* The "unknown origin" element is being investigated.

**Additional notes:**

* Issue was discussed over several days, with multiple users and Pieces team members involved.
* Communication was clear and helpful, with Mark-at-pieces and Mack-at-pieces providing updates and potential solutions.

## Conclusion

The issue with the "Basic mode" error on M3 Macs has been identified and addressed. Additionally, the accessibility of the Workstream Activity on smaller window sizes and the "unknown origin" element are being investigated. The Pieces team is actively working to resolve these issues and improve the overall user experience.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving high-frequency issues:** Focus on addressing the 'Pieces OS High CPU Usage and Slow Performance', 'Copilot Performance Issues and Unexpected Responses', 'Pieces Desktop Errors and Bugs', and 'Ollama and LLM Download and Installation Issues' as these are recurring themes impacting multiple users.

**Improve LTM stability and performance:** Many tickets relate to LTM issues, including slow performance, activation failures, and unexpected behavior. Prioritize resolving these issues to improve user experience and reduce support volume.

**Enhance Copilot responsiveness and accuracy:** Address the slow response times, unresponsiveness, and vague answers from Copilot reported by users. This may involve optimizing its performance, improving its training data, or exploring alternative LLM options.

**Provide clear and consistent error messages:** Ensure error messages are informative and guide users towards solutions. For instance, the 'Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again' error message could be more specific.

**Review and update documentation:** Ensure documentation, particularly around LTM, Ollama installation, and troubleshooting common errors, is up-to-date and comprehensive. This will empower users to self-resolve issues and reduce support requests.

**Investigate and address potential bugs in Pieces OS and Desktop Application:** Several tickets point to potential bugs, such as the inability to cancel LLM downloads, 'Basic mode' errors on M3 Macs, and application slowdowns. Thoroughly investigate and address these bugs to improve overall software stability.

**Improve communication and transparency:** Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution times. This could involve updating existing tickets, posting announcements, or creating a dedicated support forum.

**Gather detailed system information and logs:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive system information, logs, and steps to reproduce issues. This will help the support team diagnose and resolve problems more efficiently.

**Consider a dedicated bug reporting system:** Implement a dedicated bug reporting system to streamline the process of reporting, tracking, and resolving issues. This will help prioritize bug fixes and improve communication with users.

**Proactively monitor system performance and user feedback:** Implement monitoring tools to proactively identify and address performance issues before they escalate. Regularly review user feedback to identify recurring pain points and areas for improvement.
